Headline: Sports IPR expert- MD- Sportzprix
Comment:
Our company launched the Premier Badminton League, which we managed for five years until the COVID-19 pandemic. Despite featuring talented players like PV Sindhu, Saina Nehwal, Kidambi Srikanth, Lakshya Sen, Satwik-Chirag, and others, we struggled to attract big-name supporters. Some celebrities, including Akshay Kumar and SRT who initially backed the league, eventually exited. We also reached out to another legend multiple times, but he only made a brief appearance in Season 5 without promoting the league.

Every season, we invited the Union Sports Minister to attend the inaugural match or finals, but he never attended. Even India's historic Thomas Cup win in 2022 didn't translate to increased support for badminton. Despite brainstorming with legendary coach Pullela Gopichand, we couldn't raise the sport's profile as we'd hoped. Although participation in the game increased significantly during this period, we ultimately couldn't achieve our goals and had to discontinue the league.

It's disheartening that as a nation, we often overlook our true heroes.
processed_comment: our company launched the premier badminton league which we managed for five years until the covid pandemic despite featuring talented players like pv sindhu saina nehwal kidambi srikanth lakshya sen satwikchirag and others we struggled to attract bigname supporters some celebrities including akshay kumar and srt who initially backed the league eventually exited we also reached out to another legend multiple times but he only made a brief appearance in season without promoting the league every season we invited the union sports minister to attend the inaugural match or finals but he never attended even indias historic thomas cup win in didnt translate to increased support for badminton despite brainstorming with legendary coach pullela gopichand we couldnt raise the sports profile as wed hoped although participation in the game increased significantly during this period we ultimately couldnt achieve our goals and had to discontinue the league its disheartening that as a nation we often overlook our true heroes

Headline: Sports & Entertainment Partnerships Leader | Former Athlete | MBA, IIM Ahmedabad | Building High-Impact Sports IPs across India & MENA
Comment:
Chess remains one of the few truly democratic sports, your FIDE rating alone determines your standing, free from politics or personal bias. Selection for national or international competitions is purely merit-based, leaving no room for lobbying or favoritism. 

Unfortunately, most other sports in India are still tangled in a web of stakeholders, where an athlete‚Äôs future often hinges on the decisions of a third party, decisions that can be influenced by everything except performance.

Comment:
Dilip Kumar As we all know , We the Indian's are Inventors of Chess !

Let me share some interesting facts here:
 
The game of Chaturanga, which is considered the precursor to chess, originated in India during the Gupta Empire.¬†Rather than being invented by one person, chess evolved over centuries from Chaturanga into the game we know today, Chaturanga traveled to Persia (modern-day Iran) and was transformed into Shatranj, which introduced significant changes.¬†

Cricket's obsession eclipses chess¬†due to its historical roots ( The British ), widespread appeal, and consistent international success.¬†Cricket's glamour, entertainment value, and simpler gameplay make it more accessible and enjoyable for a wider audience, while chess, despite a recent surge in popularity and talent development, remains more niche.¬†
